creditline: Gift of Dr. and Mrs. John E. Larkin, Jr.
inscription:
Signature; Date; Title

see Signed

Title and Z.J. number noted in pencil at L.L. margin.
signed: in pencil at L.R. margin: [WANDA GAG  '29]
text: Wanda Gág made her own bent lampshade to produce the dramatic shadows in Lamplight. She loved the honesty of everyday objects and the associations they evoked. For her, this humble setting stood for a simpler, preindustrial time, in contrast to the blackened doorway, which suggests an unknown future. This image was first exhibited in January 1930, just a few months into the Great Depression. It became one of Gág’s most famous prints.
title: Lamplight
